member.name: T:DnsClient.Protocol.CaaRecord
member.summary:
A representing a certification authority authorization.
The Certification Authority Authorization (CAA) DNS Resource Record allows a DNS domain name holder to specify one or more Certification Authorities(CAs) authorized to issue certificates for that domain.
CAA Resource Records allow a public Certification Authority to implement additional controls to reduce the risk of unintended certificate mis-issue.This document defines the syntax of the CAA record and rules for processing CAA records by certificate issuers.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.CaaRecord.Flags
member.summary: One octet containing the flags.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.CaaRecord.Tag
member.summary: The property identifier, a sequence of US-ASCII characters.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.CaaRecord.Value
member.summary: A sequence of octets representing the property value. Property values are encoded as binary values and MAY employ sub-formats.

member.name: T:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType
member.summary:
The resource record types. The enum contains only the types supported by this library at this moment. The is used to identify any .
Resource record types are a subset of .

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.A
member.summary: A host address.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.NS
member.summary: An authoritative name server.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.MD
member.summary: A mail destination (OBSOLETE - use MX).

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.MF
member.summary: A mail forwarder (OBSOLETE - use MX).

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.CNAME
member.summary: The canonical name for an alias.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.SOA
member.summary: Marks the start of a zone of authority.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.MB
member.summary: A mailbox domain name (EXPERIMENTAL).

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.MG
member.summary: A mail group member (EXPERIMENTAL).

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.MR
member.summary: A mailbox rename domain name (EXPERIMENTAL).

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.NULL
member.summary: A Null resource record (EXPERIMENTAL).

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.WKS
member.summary: A well known service description.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.PTR
member.summary: A domain name pointer.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.HINFO
member.summary: Host information.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.MINFO
member.summary: Mailbox or mail list information.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.MX
member.summary: Mail exchange.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.TXT
member.summary: Text resources.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.RP
member.summary: Responsible Person.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.AFSDB
member.summary: AFS Data Base location.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.AAAA
member.summary: An IPv6 host address.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.SRV
member.summary: A resource record which specifies the location of the server(s) for a specific protocol and domain.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.OPT
member.summary: Option record.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.RRSIG
member.summary: RRSIG rfc3755.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.URI
member.summary: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) resource record.

member.name: F:DnsClient.Protocol.ResourceRecordType.CAA
member.summary: A certification authority authorization.

member.name: T:DnsClient.Protocol.RpRecord
member.summary: A represending a responsible person.

member.summary: Gets a domain name that specifies the mailbox for the responsible person.

member.summary: Gets a domain name for which TXT RR's exist.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:DnsClient.Protocol.SoaRecord
member.summary: A represending a SOA (Start Of Authority) record.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.SoaRecord.Expire
member.summary: Gets a 32 bit time value that specifies the upper limit on the time interval that can elapse before the zone is no longer authoritative.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.SoaRecord.Minimum
member.summary: Gets the unsigned 32 bit minimum TTL field that should be exported with any RR from this zone.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.SoaRecord.MName
member.summary: Gets the domain name of the name server that was the original or primary source of data for this zone.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.SoaRecord.Refresh
member.summary: Gets a 32 bit time interval before the zone should be refreshed.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.SoaRecord.Retry
member.summary: Gets a 32 bit time interval that should elapse before a failed refresh should be retried.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.SoaRecord.RName
member.summary: Gets a domain name which specifies the mailbox of the person responsible for this zone.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.SoaRecord.Serial
member.summary: Gets the unsigned 32 bit version number of the original copy of the zone.Zone transfers preserve this value. This value wraps and should be compared using sequence space arithmetic.

member.name: T:DnsClient.Protocol.TxtRecord
member.summary:
A represending a text resource.
TXT RRs are used to hold descriptive text. The semantics of the text depends on the domain where it is found.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.TxtRecord.EscapedText
member.summary: Gets the list of TXT values of this resource record in escaped form, valid for root file.
member.remarks: See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1035#section-5.1 for escape details.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.TxtRecord.Text
member.summary: Gets the actual UTF8 representation of the text values of this record.

member.summary: Gets or sets the weigth.

member.name: T:DnsClient.Protocol.WksRecord
member.summary: A represending a Well Known Service description.
member.remarks: Instead of describing the supported protocols in RFCs, the list is now published on http://www.iana.org/.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.WksRecord.Address
member.summary: Gets the address.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.WksRecord.Protocol
member.summary: Gets the Protocol.
member.remarks: According to https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6335, only ports for TCP, UDP, DCCP and SCTP services will be assigned.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.WksRecord.Bitmap
member.summary: Gets the binary raw bitmap. Use to determine which ports are actually configured.

member.name: P:DnsClient.Protocol.WksRecord.Ports
member.summary:
Gets the list of assigned ports.
For example, if this list contains port 25, which is assigned to the SMTP service. This means that a SMTP services is running on with transport .

member.name: T:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions
member.summary:
Extension methods for the contract.
The methods implement common queries which are more complex and have some business logic.

member.name: M:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions.GetHostEntry(DnsClient.IDnsQuery,System.String)
member.summary:
The GetHostEntry method queries a DNS server for the IP addresses and aliases associated with the . In case is an , GetHostEntry does a reverse lookup on that first to determine the hostname.
IP addresses found are returned in . records are used to populate the .
The property will be set to the resolved hostname or .
member.remarks:
The method has some logic to populate the list:
In case of sub-domain queries or similar, there might be multiple records for one ,
If only one is in the result set, all the aliases found will be returned.
If more than one is in the result set, aliases are returned only if at least one doesn't match the queried hostname.
member.param: The or host name to query for.
member.returns: An instance that contains address information about the host specified in . In case the could not be resolved to a domain name, this method returns null, unless is set to true, then it might throw a .
member.exception: In case is set to true and a DNS error occurs.

member.param: The or host name to query for.
member.returns: An instance that contains address information about the host specified in . In case the could not be resolved to a domain name, this method returns null, unless is set to true, then it might throw a .
member.exception: In case is set to true and a DNS error occurs.

member.name: M:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions.GetHostEntry(DnsClient.IDnsQuery,System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary:
The GetHostEntry method does a reverse lookup on the IP , and queries a DNS server for the IP addresses and aliases associated with the resolved hostname.
IP addresses found are returned in . records are used to populate the .
The property will be set to the resolved hostname of the .
member.remarks:
The method has some logic to populate the list:
In case of sub-domain queries or similar, there might be multiple records for one ,
If only one is in the result set, all the aliases found will be returned.
If more than one is in the result set, aliases are returned only if at least one doesn't match the queried hostname.
member.returns: An instance that contains address information about the host specified in . In case the could not be resolved to a domain name, this method returns null, unless is set to true, then it might throw a .
member.exception: In case is set to true and a DNS error occurs.

member.name: M:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions.GetHostName(DnsClient.IDnsQuery,System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: The GetHostName method queries a DNS server to resolve the hostname of the via reverse lookup.
member.returns: The hostname if the reverse lookup was successful or null, in case the host was not found. If is set to true, this method will throw an instead of returning null!
member.exception: If no host has been found and is true.

member.name: M:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions.GetHostNameAsync(DnsClient.IDnsQuery,System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: The GetHostNameAsync method queries a DNS server to resolve the hostname of the via reverse lookup.
member.returns: The hostname if the reverse lookup was successful or null, in case the host was not found. If is set to true, this method will throw an instead of returning null!

member.name: M:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions.ResolveService(DnsClient.IDnsQuery,System.String,System.String,System.Net.Sockets.ProtocolType)
member.summary:
The ResolveService method does a lookup for _{}[._{}].{} and aggregates the result (hostname, port and list of s) to a .
This method expects matching A or AAAA records to populate the , and/or a record to populate the property of the result.
member.remarks: The returned list of s and/or the hostname can be empty if no matching additional records are found.
member.param: The base domain, which will be appended to the end of the query string.
The name of the service to look for. Must not have any _ prefix.
The protocol of the service to query for. Set it to or to not pass any protocol.

member.name: M:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions.ResolveServiceAsync(DnsClient.IDnsQuery,System.String,System.String,System.Net.Sockets.ProtocolType)
member.summary:
The ResolveServiceAsync method does a lookup for _{}[._{}].{} and aggregates the result (hostname, port and list of s) to a .
This method expects matching A or AAAA records to populate the , and/or a record to populate the property of the result.
member.remarks: The returned list of s and/or the hostname can be empty if no matching additional records are found.
member.param: The base domain, which will be appended to the end of the query string.
The name of the service to look for. Must not have any _ prefix.
The protocol of the service to query for. Set it to or to not pass any protocol.

member.name: M:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions.ResolveService(DnsClient.IDnsQuery,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
The ResolveService method does a lookup for _{}[._{}].{} and aggregates the result (hostname, port and list of s) to a .
This method expects matching A or AAAA records to populate the , and/or a record to populate the property of the result.
member.remarks: The returned list of s and/or the hostname can be empty if no matching additional records are found.
member.param: The base domain, which will be appended to the end of the query string.
The name of the service to look for. Must not have any _ prefix.
An optional tag. Must not have any _ prefix.

member.name: M:DnsClient.DnsQueryExtensions.ResolveServiceAsync(DnsClient.IDnsQuery,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
The ResolveServiceAsync method does a lookup for _{}[._{}].{} and aggregates the result (hostname, port and list of s) to a .
This method expects matching A or AAAA records to populate the , and/or a record to populate the property of the result.
member.remarks: The returned list of s and/or the hostname can be empty if no matching additional records are found.
member.param: The base domain, which will be appended to the end of the query string.
The name of the service to look for. Must not have any _ prefix.
An optional tag. Must not have any _ prefix.

member.name: T:DnsClient.DnsRequestMessage
member.summary: Represents a simple request message which can be send through .

member.name: T:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode
member.summary: Response codes of the .

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.NoError
member.summary: No error condition

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.FormatError
member.summary: Format error. The name server was unable to interpret the query.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.ServerFailure
member.summary: Server failure. The name server was unable to process this query due to a problem with the name server.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.NotExistentDomain
member.summary: Name Error. Meaningful only for responses from an authoritative name server, this code signifies that the domain name referenced in the query does not exist.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: Not Implemented. The name server does not support the requested kind of query.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.Refused
member.summary: Refused. The name server refuses to perform the specified operation for policy reasons. For example, a name server may not wish to provide the information to the particular requester, or a name server may not wish to perform a particular operation (e.g., zone transfer) for particular data.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.ExistingDomain
member.summary: Name Exists when it should not.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.ExistingResourceRecordSet
member.summary: Resource record set exists when it should not.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.MissingResourceRecordSet
member.summary: Resource record set that should exist but does not.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.NotAuthorized
member.summary: Server Not Authoritative for zone / Not Authorized.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.NotZone
member.summary: Name not contained in zone.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.BadVersionOrBadSignature
member.summary: Bad OPT Version or TSIG Signature Failure.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.BadKey
member.summary: Key not recognized.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.BadTime
member.summary: Signature out of time window.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.BadMode
member.summary: Bad TKEY Mode.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.BadName
member.summary: Duplicate key name.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.BadAlgorithm
member.summary: Algorithm not supported.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.BadTruncation
member.summary: Bad Truncation.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.BadCookie
member.summary: Bad/missing Server Cookie

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.Unassigned
member.summary: Unknown error.

member.name: F:DnsClient.DnsResponseCode.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Indicates a timeout error. Connection to the remote server couldn't be established.

member.name: T:DnsClient.ILookupClient
member.summary:
The contract for the LookupClient including all the options.
The interfaces for the query methods and the lookup client properties are separated so that one can inject or expose only the without exposing the configuration options.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.EnableAuditTrail
member.summary: If enabled, each will contain a full documentation of the response in zone file format.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.UseCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the should use response caching or not. The cache duration is calculated by the resource record of the response. Usually, the lowest TTL is used.
member.remarks: In case the DNS Server returns records with a TTL of zero. The response cannot be cached. Setting can overwrite this behavior and cache those responses anyways for at least the given duration.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.MinimumCacheTimeout
member.summary:
Gets or sets a which can override the TTL of a resource record in case the TTL of the record is lower than this minimum value.
This is useful in cases where the server retruns records with zero TTL.
This setting gets igonred in case is set to false.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.NameServers
member.summary: Gets the list of configured name servers.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.Recursion
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if DNS queries should instruct the DNS server to do recursive lookups, or not.
member.value: The flag indicating if recursion should be used or not.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.Retries
member.summary: Gets or sets number of tries to connect to one name server before trying the next one or throwing an exception.

Gets or sets the number of retries the client can perform in connection or timeout errors during query operations.
If set to 0, no retries will be performed.
member.value: The number of alloed retries before exceptions will bubble up.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.ThrowDnsErrors
member.summary:
Gets or sets a flag indicating if the should throw an if a query result has a other than .
If set to false, the 's flag can be expected. The will contain more information and the transports the original .
If set to true, any query method of will throw an if the response header indicates an error. The actual code and message can be accessed via and of the .

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout in milliseconds. is used for limiting the connection and request time for one operation. Timeout must be greater than zero and less than . If set to (or -1), no timeout will be applied.
member.remarks:
If set too short, queries will more likely result in s.
Important to note, s will be retried, if are not disabled. This should help in case one or more configured DNS servers are not reachable or under load for example.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.UseTcpFallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if Tcp should not be used in case a Udp response is truncated. If true, truncated results will potentially yield no answers.

member.name: P:DnsClient.ILookupClient.UseTcpOnly
member.summary:
Gets or sets a flag indicating if Udp should not be used at all.
Use this only if Udp cannot be used because of your firewall rules for example.

member.name: T:DnsClient.LookupClient
member.summary:
The is the main query class of this library and should be used for any kind of DNS lookup query.
It implements and which contains a number of extension methods, too. The extension methods internally all invoke the standard queries though.

member.name: M:DnsClient.LookupClient.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of without specifying any name server. This will implicitly use the name server(s) configured by the local network adapter.
member.remarks: This uses . The resulting list of name servers is highly dependent on the local network configuration and OS.

member.name: M:DnsClient.LookupClient.#ctor(System.Net.IPAddress[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with one or more DNS servers identified by their . The default port 53 will be used for all s provided.
member.param: The (s) to be used by this instance.

member.name: M:DnsClient.LookupClient.#ctor(System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new instance of with one DNS server defined by and .
member.param: The port of the DNS server.
member.example:
In case you want to connect to one specific DNS server which does not run on the default port 53, you can do so like in the following example:
var client = new LookupClient(IPAddress.Parse("127.0.0.1"), 8600);

member.name: M:DnsClient.LookupClient.#ctor(System.Net.IPEndPoint[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with one or more and port combination stored in (s).
member.param: The (s) to be used by this instance.

member.name: M:DnsClient.LookupClient.QueryReverseAsync(System.Net.IPAddress)
member.remarks: The behavior of the query can be controlled by the properties of this instance. for example can be disabled and would instruct the DNS server to return no additional records.

member.name: T:System.IO.RowConfigReader
member.summary: Helper for reading config files where each row is a key-value data pair. The input key-values must not have any whitespace within them. Keys are only matched if they begin a line, with no preceding whitespace.

member.name: M:System.IO.RowConfigReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new RowConfigReader which reads from the given string. The string to parse through.

member.name: M:System.IO.RowConfigReader.#ctor(System.String,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Constructs a new RowConfigReader which reads from the given string. The string to parse through. The comparison kind to use.

member.name: M:System.IO.RowConfigReader.GetNextValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the next occurrence of the given key, from the current position of the reader, or throws if no occurrence of the key exists in the remainder of the string.

member.name: M:System.IO.RowConfigReader.TryGetNextValue(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to get the next occurrence of the given key from the current position of the reader. If successful, returns true and stores the result in 'value'. Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: M:System.IO.RowConfigReader.GetNextValueAsInt32(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the next occurrence of the key in the string, and parses it as an Int32. Throws if the key is not found in the remainder of the string, or if the key cannot be successfully parsed into an Int32.
member.remarks: This is mainly provided as a helper because most Linux config/info files store integral data.

member.name: M:System.IO.RowConfigReader.ReadFirstValueFromString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads the value of the first occurrence of the given key contained in the string given.
member.returns: The value of the row containing the first occurrence of the key.

member.name: T:System.Net.IpAddressExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for .

member.name: M:System.Net.IpAddressExtensions.GetArpaName(System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: Translates a IPv4 or IPv6 into an arpa address. Used for reverse DNS lookup to get the domain name of the given .
member.returns: The arpa representation of the address.
